name: Macadamia Nuts
description: Macadamia nuts are renowned for their rich, buttery flavor and smooth, creamy texture. These premium nuts are a luxurious treat packed with healthy fats and nutrients.
characteristics: Buttery flavor, creamy texture, rich and smooth

terroir.geography: Queensland and New South Wales coastal regions, subtropical rainforests of Australia
terroir.climate: Subtropical with high rainfall (1,000-2,000mm annually), warm humid summers ideal for macadamia growth
terroir.soil: Rich volcanic soil with excellent drainage and slightly acidic pH - the secret to buttery richness
terroir.whySpecial: Macadamias are native to Australia - they evolved in Queensland rainforests over millions of years. The volcanic soil creates nuts with unmatched buttery texture that simply cannot be replicated elsewhere. Australian macadamias set the global standard.

originStory: Macadamia nuts are Australia's native treasure, evolved over millions of years in the subtropical rainforests of Queensland. The rich volcanic soil and high rainfall create nuts with an incredibly buttery texture and delicate, almost creamy flavor. Australian macadamias are considered the world's finest - the terroir simply cannot be replicated. These are the nuts that set the global standard for quality.
tastingNotes: Buttery rich, creamy texture, delicate sweet flavor, satisfying crunch, luxurious mouthfeel that melts on the tongue
whyWeCare: Australian terroir creates the world's best macadamias. We source directly to ensure you get the buttery richness that only volcanic soil can provide. No other origin comes close to Australian quality.

nutritionalHighlights.reason: Premium nuts with the highest monounsaturated fat content of any nut - buttery, creamy, and heart-healthy.
